questions.question: A security analyst is reviewing vulnerability scan results and notices multiple critical vulnerabilities in legacy systems that cannot be patched due to business requirements. Which of the following would be the MOST appropriate next step?
options: Implement network segmentation to isolate the vulnerable systems
Accept the risk and document it in the risk register
Immediately take the systems offline until they can be replaced
Deploy honeypots to distract attackers from the vulnerable systems

questions.question: A security analyst needs to prioritize vulnerabilities for remediation. The organization has limited resources and must focus on the most critical issues first. Which of the following factors would be MOST important to consider when prioritizing?
options: The age of the vulnerability
Whether the vulnerability has an exploit available in the wild
The vendor who reported the vulnerability
The complexity of the patch installation

questions.question: A security analyst is conducting threat modeling for a new web application. Which of the following approaches would be MOST effective for identifying potential security threats?
options: Code review of the application
Penetration testing of the production environment
STRIDE methodology analyzing each component
Reviewing similar applications' security incidents

questions.question: An organization's security team is implementing a vulnerability management program. Which of the following metrics would be MOST useful for measuring the program's effectiveness?
options: Number of vulnerabilities detected per scan
Average time to remediate critical vulnerabilities
Number of security tools deployed
Cost of vulnerability scanning tools

questions.question: A security analyst is reviewing logs from a web application firewall and notices a pattern of requests containing SQL syntax in form fields. Which of the following attacks is MOST likely being attempted?
options: Cross-site scripting
SQL injection
Buffer overflow
Session hijacking

questions.question: A security analyst receives an alert about an application behaving suspiciously. Investigation reveals the application is making DNS requests to randomly generated domain names every few minutes. Which of the following is the MOST likely explanation?
options: The application is using DNS load balancing
The application is attempting to exfiltrate data through DNS tunneling
The application is using a domain generation algorithm for command and control
The application is performing DNS cache poisoning

questions.question: A security analyst needs to secure a DevOps pipeline to ensure that vulnerable code is not deployed to production. Which of the following would be the MOST effective approach?
options: Manual code review before each deployment
Weekly vulnerability scans of production systems
Integrating automated security testing into the CI/CD pipeline
Requiring developers to sign their code before committing

questions.question: A security analyst is investigating suspicious behavior on a Linux server. Which command would be MOST useful to identify unusual processes and their network connections?
options: ps aux
netstat -tulpn
ls -la /proc
cat /var/log/auth.log

questions.question: A SOC analyst notices an unusual spike in failed login attempts across multiple critical systems at 3:00 AM. Which of the following should be the FIRST step in responding to this situation?
options: Block all external access to the affected systems
Reset all user passwords across the organization
Collect and analyze logs to determine the pattern and source of attempts
Shut down the affected systems immediately

questions.question: A security analyst wants to implement a solution that will detect previously unknown malware based on behavioral analysis rather than signatures. Which type of security control would be MOST appropriate?
options: Host-based intrusion detection system (HIDS)
Signature-based antivirus software
User behavior analytics (UBA) platform
Security information and event management (SIEM) system

questions.question: An organization is experiencing a high rate of false positives from their intrusion detection system. Which of the following actions would be MOST effective in reducing false positives while maintaining security?
options: Switch from IDS to IPS to block all suspicious traffic
Disable the IDS entirely and rely on firewall logs
Tune the IDS rules and thresholds based on normal network behavior
Implement a honeypot to divert attacks from production systems

questions.question: A security analyst is configuring a SIEM solution for an organization. Which of the following log sources would provide the MOST value for detecting lateral movement within the network?
options: Firewall logs
Domain controller authentication logs
Web server access logs
Email gateway logs

questions.question: During a security incident, a security analyst discovers that several user accounts have been compromised. Which of the following should be done FIRST?
options: Disable the compromised accounts
Reset passwords for all users in the organization
Restore the accounts from backup
Update the antivirus signatures

questions.question: A security analyst has confirmed that a system has been compromised by malware. Which of the following would be the MOST important data to capture before disconnecting the system from the network?
options: Registry entries
Running processes and network connections
Installed applications
User account information

questions.question: During a security incident, a junior analyst wants to immediately reimage an affected server to restore service quickly. As the senior analyst, what would be your MOST appropriate response?
options: Approve the reimaging to minimize downtime
Preserve an image of the system for forensic analysis before reimaging
Run an antivirus scan instead of reimaging
Wait for the CEO's approval before taking any action

questions.question: After containing a security incident, which of the following tasks would be MOST important during the eradication phase?
options: Notifying customers about the breach
Conducting a lessons learned session
Identifying and eliminating the root cause of the incident
Testing system performance

questions.question: A security analyst is preparing for a compliance audit and needs to verify that all critical security patches have been applied across the organization. Which of the following would provide the MOST comprehensive view of patch compliance?
options: Reviewing change management documentation
Conducting a full vulnerability scan of all systems
Checking vendor websites for released patches
Interviewing system administrators about patching practices

questions.question: An organization needs to demonstrate compliance with multiple regulatory frameworks. Which of the following approaches would be MOST efficient for managing compliance requirements?
options: Assigning a compliance officer for each regulatory framework
Creating separate security controls for each framework
Implementing a unified compliance framework that maps controls to multiple regulations
Outsourcing all compliance activities to a third party

questions.question: A security analyst is conducting a risk assessment for an organization's new cloud-based application. Which of the following would be the MOST important to evaluate?
options: The cloud provider's marketing materials
The service level agreement and shared responsibility model
The physical location of the cloud provider's data centers
The cloud provider's number of customers

questions.question: A security analyst is tasked with evaluating the effectiveness of the organization's security awareness program. Which of the following metrics would provide the MOST meaningful measurement?
options: Number of employees who completed training
Reduction in security incidents caused by employee errors
Length of the security awareness training sessions
Employee satisfaction surveys about the training
